The default value returns an empty data_frame_analytics array when there
are no matches and the subset of results when there are partial matches.
If this parameter is `false`, the request returns a 404 status code when
there are no matches or only partial matches.

ml.get_data_frame_analytics-from.name: from
ml.get_data_frame_analytics-from.description: Skips the specified number of data frame analytics jobs.

ml.get_data_frame_analytics-size.name: size
ml.get_data_frame_analytics-size.description: Specifies the maximum number of data frame analytics jobs to obtain.

ml.get_data_frame_analytics-exclude_gene.name: exclude_generated
ml.get_data_frame_analytics-exclude_gene.description:
Indicates if certain fields should be removed from the configuration on
retrieval. This allows the configuration to be in an acceptable format to
be retrieved and then added to another cluster.

ml.get_data_frame_analytics_stats-id.name: id
ml.get_data_frame_analytics_stats-id.description:
Identifier for the data frame analytics job. If you do not specify this
option, the API returns information for the first hundred data frame
analytics jobs.

ml.get_data_frame_analytics_stats-allow_.name: allow_no_match
ml.get_data_frame_analytics_stats-allow_.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

1. Contains wildcard expressions and there are no data frame analytics
jobs that match.
2. Contains the `_all` string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
3. Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

The default value returns an empty data_frame_analytics array when there
are no matches and the subset of results when there are partial matches.
If this parameter is `false`, the request returns a 404 status code when
there are no matches or only partial matches.

ml.get_data_frame_analytics_stats-from.name: from
ml.get_data_frame_analytics_stats-from.description: Skips the specified number of data frame analytics jobs.

ml.get_data_frame_analytics_stats-size.name: size
ml.get_data_frame_analytics_stats-size.description: Specifies the maximum number of data frame analytics jobs to obtain.

ml.get_data_frame_analytics_stats-verbos.name: verbose
ml.get_data_frame_analytics_stats-verbos.description: Defines whether the stats response should be verbose.

ml.get_datafeed_stats-datafeed_id.name: datafeed_id
ml.get_datafeed_stats-datafeed_id.description:
Identifier for the datafeed. It can be a datafeed identifier or a
wildcard expression. If you do not specify one of these options, the API
returns information about all datafeeds.

ml.get_datafeed_stats-allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
ml.get_datafeed_stats-allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

1. Contains wildcard expressions and there are no datafeeds that match.
2. Contains the `_all` string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
3. Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

The default value is `true`, which returns an empty `datafeeds` array
when there are no matches and the subset of results when there are
partial matches. If this parameter is `false`, the request returns a
`404` status code when there are no matches or only partial matches.

ml.get_datafeeds-datafeed_id.name: datafeed_id
ml.get_datafeeds-datafeed_id.description:
Identifier for the datafeed. It can be a datafeed identifier or a
wildcard expression. If you do not specify one of these options, the API
returns information about all datafeeds.

ml.get_datafeeds-allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
ml.get_datafeeds-allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

1. Contains wildcard expressions and there are no datafeeds that match.
2. Contains the `_all` string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
3. Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

The default value is `true`, which returns an empty `datafeeds` array
when there are no matches and the subset of results when there are
partial matches. If this parameter is `false`, the request returns a
`404` status code when there are no matches or only partial matches.

ml.get_datafeeds-exclude_generated.name: exclude_generated
ml.get_datafeeds-exclude_generated.description:
Indicates if certain fields should be removed from the configuration on
retrieval. This allows the configuration to be in an acceptable format to
be retrieved and then added to another cluster.

ml.get_filters-filter_id.name: filter_id
ml.get_filters-filter_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies a filter.

ml.get_filters-from.name: from
ml.get_filters-from.description: Skips the specified number of filters.

ml.get_filters-size.name: size
ml.get_filters-size.description: Specifies the maximum number of filters to obtain.

ml.get_job_stats-job_id.name: job_id
ml.get_job_stats-job_id.description:
Identifier for the anomaly detection job. It can be a job identifier, a
group name, a comma-separated list of jobs, or a wildcard expression. If
you do not specify one of these options, the API returns information for
all anomaly detection jobs.

ml.get_job_stats-allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
ml.get_job_stats-allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

1. Contains wildcard expressions and there are no jobs that match.
2. Contains the _all string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
3. Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

If `true`, the API returns an empty `jobs` array when
there are no matches and the subset of results when there are partial
matches. If `false`, the API returns a `404` status
code when there are no matches or only partial matches.

ml.get_jobs-job_id.name: job_id
ml.get_jobs-job_id.description:
Identifier for the anomaly detection job. It can be a job identifier, a
group name, or a wildcard expression. If you do not specify one of these
options, the API returns information for all anomaly detection jobs.

ml.get_jobs-allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
ml.get_jobs-allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

1. Contains wildcard expressions and there are no jobs that match.
2. Contains the _all string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
3. Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

The default value is `true`, which returns an empty `jobs` array when
there are no matches and the subset of results when there are partial
matches. If this parameter is `false`, the request returns a `404` status
code when there are no matches or only partial matches.

ml.get_jobs-exclude_generated.name: exclude_generated
ml.get_jobs-exclude_generated.description:
Indicates if certain fields should be removed from the configuration on
retrieval. This allows the configuration to be in an acceptable format to
be retrieved and then added to another cluster.

ml.get_overall_buckets-job_id.name: job_id
ml.get_overall_buckets-job_id.description:
Identifier for the anomaly detection job. It can be a job identifier, a
group name, a comma-separated list of jobs or groups, or a wildcard
expression.

You can summarize the bucket results for all anomaly detection jobs by
using `_all` or by specifying `*` as the `<job_id>`.

ml.get_overall_buckets-allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
ml.get_overall_buckets-allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

1. Contains wildcard expressions and there are no jobs that match.
2. Contains the `_all` string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
3. Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

If `true`, the request returns an empty `jobs` array when there are no
matches and the subset of results when there are partial matches. If this
parameter is `false`, the request returns a `404` status code when there
are no matches or only partial matches.

ml.get_overall_buckets-bucket_span.name: bucket_span
ml.get_overall_buckets-bucket_span.description:
The span of the overall buckets. Must be greater or equal to the largest
bucket span of the specified anomaly detection jobs, which is the default
value.

By default, an overall bucket has a span equal to the largest bucket span
of the specified anomaly detection jobs. To override that behavior, use
the optional `bucket_span` parameter.

ml.get_overall_buckets-end.name: end
ml.get_overall_buckets-end.description: Returns overall buckets with timestamps earlier than this time.

ml.get_overall_buckets-exclude_interim.name: exclude_interim
ml.get_overall_buckets-exclude_interim.description: If `true`, the output excludes interim results.

ml.get_overall_buckets-overall_score.name: overall_score
ml.get_overall_buckets-overall_score.description:
Returns overall buckets with overall scores greater than or equal to this
value.

ml.get_overall_buckets-start.name: start
ml.get_overall_buckets-start.description: Returns overall buckets with timestamps after this time.

ml.get_overall_buckets-top_n.name: top_n
ml.get_overall_buckets-top_n.description:
The number of top anomaly detection job bucket scores to be used in the
`overall_score` calculation.

ml.get_trained_models-model_id.name: model_id
ml.get_trained_models-model_id.description:
The unique identifier of the trained model or a model alias.

You can get information for multiple trained models in a single API
request by using a comma-separated list of model IDs or a wildcard
expression.

ml.get_trained_models-allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
ml.get_trained_models-allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

- Contains wildcard expressions and there are no models that match.
- Contains the _all string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
- Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

If true, it returns an empty array when there are no matches and the
subset of results when there are partial matches.

ml.get_trained_models-decompress_definit.name: decompress_definition
ml.get_trained_models-decompress_definit.description:
Specifies whether the included model definition should be returned as a
JSON map (true) or in a custom compressed format (false).

ml.get_trained_models-exclude_generated.name: exclude_generated
ml.get_trained_models-exclude_generated.description:
Indicates if certain fields should be removed from the configuration on
retrieval. This allows the configuration to be in an acceptable format to
be retrieved and then added to another cluster.

ml.get_trained_models-from.name: from
ml.get_trained_models-from.description: Skips the specified number of models.

ml.get_trained_models-include.name: include
ml.get_trained_models-include.description:
A comma delimited string of optional fields to include in the response
body.

ml.get_trained_models-size.name: size
ml.get_trained_models-size.description: Specifies the maximum number of models to obtain.

ml.get_trained_models-tags.name: tags
ml.get_trained_models-tags.description:
A comma delimited string of tags. A trained model can have many tags, or
none. When supplied, only trained models that contain all the supplied
tags are returned.

ml.get_trained_models_stats-model_id.name: model_id
ml.get_trained_models_stats-model_id.description:
The unique identifier of the trained model or a model alias. It can be a
comma-separated list or a wildcard expression.

ml.get_trained_models_stats-allow_no_mat.name: allow_no_match
ml.get_trained_models_stats-allow_no_mat.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

- Contains wildcard expressions and there are no models that match.
- Contains the _all string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
- Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

If true, it returns an empty array when there are no matches and the
subset of results when there are partial matches.

ml.get_trained_models_stats-from.name: from
ml.get_trained_models_stats-from.description: Skips the specified number of models.

ml.get_trained_models_stats-size.name: size
ml.get_trained_models_stats-size.description: Specifies the maximum number of models to obtain.

ml.infer_trained_model-model_id.name: model_id
ml.infer_trained_model-model_id.description: The unique identifier of the trained model.

ml.infer_trained_model-timeout.name: timeout
ml.infer_trained_model-timeout.description: Controls the amount of time to wait for inference results.

ml.preview_data_frame_analytics-id.name: id
ml.preview_data_frame_analytics-id.description: Identifier for the data frame analytics job.

ml.preview_datafeed-datafeed_id.name: datafeed_id
ml.preview_datafeed-datafeed_id.description:
A numerical character string that uniquely identifies the datafeed. This identifier can contain lowercase
alphanumeric characters (a-z and 0-9), hyphens, and underscores. It must start and end with alphanumeric
characters. NOTE: If you use this path parameter, you cannot provide datafeed or anomaly detection job
configuration details in the request body.

ml.preview_datafeed-start.name: start
ml.preview_datafeed-start.description: The start time from where the datafeed preview should begin

ml.preview_datafeed-end.name: end
ml.preview_datafeed-end.description: The end time when the datafeed preview should stop

msearch-index.name: index
msearch-index.description: Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and index aliases to search.

msearch-allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
msearch-allow_no_indices.description: If false, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or _all value targets only missing or closed indices. This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices. For example, a request targeting foo*,bar* returns an error if an index starts with foo but no index starts with bar.

msearch-ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
msearch-ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If true, network roundtrips between the coordinating node and remote clusters are minimized for cross-cluster search requests.

msearch-expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
msearch-expand_wildcards.description: Type of index that wildcard expressions can match. If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.

msearch-ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
msearch-ignore_throttled.description: If true, concrete, expanded or aliased indices are ignored when frozen.

msearch-ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
msearch-ignore_unavailable.description: If true, missing or closed indices are not included in the response.

msearch-include_named_queries_score.name: include_named_queries_score
msearch-include_named_queries_score.description:
Indicates whether hit.matched_queries should be rendered as a map that includes
the name of the matched query associated with its score (true)
or as an array containing the name of the matched queries (false)
This functionality reruns each named query on every hit in a search response.
Typically, this adds a small overhead to a request.
However, using computationally expensive named queries on a large number of hits may add significant overhead.

msearch-index_.name: index
msearch-index_.description: Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and index aliases to use as default

msearch-max_concurrent_searches.name: max_concurrent_searches
msearch-max_concurrent_searches.description: Maximum number of concurrent searches the multi search API can execute.

msearch-max_concurrent_shard_requests.name: max_concurrent_shard_requests
msearch-max_concurrent_shard_requests.description: Maximum number of concurrent shard requests that each sub-search request executes per node.

msearch-pre_filter_shard_size.name: pre_filter_shard_size
msearch-pre_filter_shard_size.description: Defines a threshold that enforces a pre-filter roundtrip to prefilter search shards based on query rewriting if the number of shards the search request expands to exceeds the threshold. This filter roundtrip can limit the number of shards significantly if for instance a shard can not match any documents based on its rewrite method i.e., if date filters are mandatory to match but the shard bounds and the query are disjoint.

msearch-rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
msearch-rest_total_hits_as_int.description: If true, hits.total are returned as an integer in the response. Defaults to false, which returns an object.

msearch-routing.name: routing
msearch-routing.description: Custom routing value used to route search operations to a specific shard.

msearch-search_type.name: search_type
msearch-search_type.description: Indicates whether global term and document frequencies should be used when scoring returned documents.

msearch-typed_keys.name: typed_keys
msearch-typed_keys.description: Specifies whether aggregation and suggester names should be prefixed by their respective types in the response.

msearch_template-index.name: index
msearch_template-index.description:
A comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
It supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*`.

msearch_template-ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
msearch_template-ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If `true`, network round-trips are minimized for cross-cluster search requests.

msearch_template-max_concurrent_searches.name: max_concurrent_searches
msearch_template-max_concurrent_searches.description: The maximum number of concurrent searches the API can run.

msearch_template-search_type.name: search_type
msearch_template-search_type.description: The type of the search operation.

msearch_template-rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
msearch_template-rest_total_hits_as_int.description:
If `true`, the response returns `hits.total` as an integer.
If `false`, it returns `hits.total` as an object.

msearch_template-typed_keys.name: typed_keys
msearch_template-typed_keys.description: If `true`, the response prefixes aggregation and suggester names with their respective types.

mtermvectors-index.name: index
mtermvectors-index.description: The name of the index that contains the documents.

mtermvectors-ids.name: ids
mtermvectors-ids.description: A comma-separated list of documents ids. You must define ids as parameter or set "ids" or "docs" in the request body

mtermvectors-fields.name: fields
mtermvectors-fields.description:
A comma-separated list or wildcard expressions of fields to include in the statistics.
It is used as the default list unless a specific field list is provided in the `completion_fields` or `fielddata_fields` parameters.

mtermvectors-field_statistics.name: field_statistics
mtermvectors-field_statistics.description: If `true`, the response includes the document count, sum of document frequencies, and sum of total term frequencies.

mtermvectors-offsets.name: offsets
mtermvectors-offsets.description: If `true`, the response includes term offsets.

mtermvectors-payloads.name: payloads
mtermvectors-payloads.description: If `true`, the response includes term payloads.

mtermvectors-positions.name: positions
mtermvectors-positions.description: If `true`, the response includes term positions.

mtermvectors-preference.name: preference
mtermvectors-preference.description:
The node or shard the operation should be performed on.
It is random by default.

mtermvectors-realtime.name: realtime
mtermvectors-realtime.description: If true, the request is real-time as opposed to near-real-time.

mtermvectors-routing.name: routing
mtermvectors-routing.description: A custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

mtermvectors-term_statistics.name: term_statistics
mtermvectors-term_statistics.description: If true, the response includes term frequency and document frequency.

mtermvectors-version.name: version
mtermvectors-version.description: If `true`, returns the document version as part of a hit.

put_script-id.name: id
put_script-id.description:
The identifier for the stored script or search template.
It must be unique within the cluster.

put_script-context.name: context
put_script-context.description:
The context in which the script or search template should run.
To prevent errors, the API immediately compiles the script or template in this context.

put_script-context_.name: context
put_script-context_.description:
The context in which the script or search template should run.
To prevent errors, the API immediately compiles the script or template in this context.
If you specify both this and the `<context>` path parameter, the API uses the request path parameter.

put_script-master_timeout.name: master_timeout
put_script-master_timeout.description:
The period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
It can also be set to `-1` to indicate that the request should never timeout.

put_script-timeout.name: timeout
put_script-timeout.description:
The period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
It can also be set to `-1` to indicate that the request should never timeout.

rank_eval-index.name: index
rank_eval-index.description:
A  comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and index aliases used to limit the request.
Wildcard (`*`) expressions are supported.
To target all data streams and indices in a cluster, omit this parameter or use `_all` or `*`.

rank_eval-allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
rank_eval-allow_no_indices.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices. This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices. For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

rank_eval-expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
rank_eval-expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

rank_eval-ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
rank_eval-ignore_unavailable.description: If `true`, missing or closed indices are not included in the response.

render_search_template-id.name: id
render_search_template-id.description:
The ID of the search template to render.
If no `source` is specified, this or the `id` request body parameter is required.

scroll-scroll.name: scroll
scroll-scroll.description: The period to retain the search context for scrolling.

scroll-scroll_id_.name: scroll_id
scroll-scroll_id_.description: The scroll ID for scrolled search

scroll-rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
scroll-rest_total_hits_as_int.description: If true, the API responses hit.total property is returned as an integer. If false, the API responses hit.total property is returned as an object.

search-index.name: index
search-index.description:
A comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
It supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

search-allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
search-allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.
For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

search-allow_partial_search_results.name: allow_partial_search_results
search-allow_partial_search_results.description:
If `true` and there are shard request timeouts or shard failures, the request returns partial results.
If `false`, it returns an error with no partial results.

To override the default behavior, you can set the `search.default_allow_partial_results` cluster setting to `false`.

search-analyzer.name: analyzer
search-analyzer.description:
The analyzer to use for the query string.
This parameter can be used only when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

search-analyze_wildcard.name: analyze_wildcard
search-analyze_wildcard.description:
If `true`, wildcard and prefix queries are analyzed.
This parameter can be used only when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

search-batched_reduce_size.name: batched_reduce_size
search-batched_reduce_size.description:
The number of shard results that should be reduced at once on the coordinating node.
If the potential number of shards in the request can be large, this value should be used as a protection mechanism to reduce the memory overhead per search request.

search-ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
search-ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If `true`, network round-trips between the coordinating node and the remote clusters are minimized when running cross-cluster search (CCS) requests.

search-default_operator.name: default_operator
search-default_operator.description:
The default operator for the query string query: `AND` or `OR`.
This parameter can be used only when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

search-df.name: df
search-df.description:
The field to use as a default when no field prefix is given in the query string.
This parameter can be used only when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

search-docvalue_fields.name: docvalue_fields
search-docvalue_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return as the docvalue representation of a field for each hit.

search-expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
search-expand_wildcards.description:
The type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
It supports comma-separated values such as `open,hidden`.

search-explain.name: explain
search-explain.description: If `true`, the request returns detailed information about score computation as part of a hit.

search-ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
search-ignore_throttled.description: If `true`, concrete, expanded or aliased indices will be ignored when frozen.

search-ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
search-ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

search-include_named_queries_score.name: include_named_queries_score
search-include_named_queries_score.description:
If `true`, the response includes the score contribution from any named queries.

This functionality reruns each named query on every hit in a search response.
Typically, this adds a small overhead to a request.
However, using computationally expensive named queries on a large number of hits may add significant overhead.

search-lenient.name: lenient
search-lenient.description:
If `true`, format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) in the query string will be ignored.
This parameter can be used only when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

search-max_concurrent_shard_requests.name: max_concurrent_shard_requests
search-max_concurrent_shard_requests.description:
The number of concurrent shard requests per node that the search runs concurrently.
This value should be used to limit the impact of the search on the cluster in order to limit the number of concurrent shard requests.

search-min_compatible_shard_node.name: min_compatible_shard_node
search-min_compatible_shard_node.description:
The minimum version of the node that can handle the request
Any handling node with a lower version will fail the request.

search-preference.name: preference

search-pre_filter_shard_size.name: pre_filter_shard_size
search-pre_filter_shard_size.description:
A threshold that enforces a pre-filter roundtrip to prefilter search shards based on query rewriting if the number of shards the search request expands to exceeds the threshold.
This filter roundtrip can limit the number of shards significantly if for instance a shard can not match any documents based on its rewrite method (if date filters are mandatory to match but the shard bounds and the query are disjoint).
When unspecified, the pre-filter phase is executed if any of these conditions is met:

* The request targets more than 128 shards.
* The request targets one or more read-only index.
* The primary sort of the query targets an indexed field.

search-request_cache.name: request_cache
search-request_cache.description:
If `true`, the caching of search results is enabled for requests where `size` is `0`.
It defaults to index level settings.

search-routing.name: routing
search-routing.description: A custom value that is used to route operations to a specific shard.

search-scroll.name: scroll
search-scroll.description:
The period to retain the search context for scrolling.
By default, this value cannot exceed `1d` (24 hours).
You can change this limit by using the `search.max_keep_alive` cluster-level setting.

search-search_type.name: search_type
search-search_type.description: Indicates how distributed term frequencies are calculated for relevance scoring.

search-stats.name: stats
search-stats.description: Specific `tag` of the request for logging and statistical purposes.

search-stored_fields.name: stored_fields
search-stored_fields.description:
A comma-separated list of stored fields to return as part of a hit.
If no fields are specified, no stored fields are included in the response.
If this field is specified, the `_source` parameter defaults to `false`.
You can pass `_source: true` to return both source fields and stored fields in the search response.

search-suggest_field.name: suggest_field
search-suggest_field.description: The field to use for suggestions.

search-suggest_mode.name: suggest_mode
search-suggest_mode.description:
The suggest mode.
This parameter can be used only when the `suggest_field` and `suggest_text` query string parameters are specified.

search-suggest_size.name: suggest_size
search-suggest_size.description:
The number of suggestions to return.
This parameter can be used only when the `suggest_field` and `suggest_text` query string parameters are specified.

search-suggest_text.name: suggest_text
search-suggest_text.description:
The source text for which the suggestions should be returned.
This parameter can be used only when the `suggest_field` and `suggest_text` query string parameters are specified.

search-terminate_after.name: terminate_after
search-terminate_after.description:
The maximum number of documents to collect for each shard.
If a query reaches this limit, Elasticsearch terminates the query early.
Elasticsearch collects documents before sorting.

IMPORTANT: Use with caution.
Elasticsearch applies this parameter to each shard handling the request.
When possible, let Elasticsearch perform early termination automatically.
Avoid specifying this parameter for requests that target data streams with backing indices across multiple data tiers.
If set to `0` (default), the query does not terminate early.

search-timeout.name: timeout
search-timeout.description:
The period of time to wait for a response from each shard.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
It defaults to no timeout.

search-track_total_hits.name: track_total_hits
search-track_total_hits.description:
The number of hits matching the query to count accurately.
If `true`, the exact number of hits is returned at the cost of some performance.
If `false`, the response does not include the total number of hits matching the query.

search-track_scores.name: track_scores
search-track_scores.description: If `true`, the request calculates and returns document scores, even if the scores are not used for sorting.

search-typed_keys.name: typed_keys
search-typed_keys.description: If `true`, aggregation and suggester names are be prefixed by their respective types in the response.

search-rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
search-rest_total_hits_as_int.description: Indicates whether `hits.total` should be rendered as an integer or an object in the rest search response.

search-version.name: version
search-version.description: If `true`, the request returns the document version as part of a hit.

search-_source.name: _source
search-_source.description:
The source fields that are returned for matching documents.
These fields are returned in the `hits._source` property of the search response.
Valid values are:

* `true` to return the entire document source.
* `false` to not return the document source.
* `<string>` to return the source fields that are specified as a comma-separated list that supports wildcard (`*`) patterns.

search-_source_excludes.name: _source_excludes
search-_source_excludes.description:
A comma-separated list of source fields to exclude from the response.
You can also use this parameter to exclude fields from the subset specified in `_source_includes` query parameter.
If the `_source` parameter is `false`, this parameter is ignored.

search-_source_includes.name: _source_includes
search-_source_includes.description:
A comma-separated list of source fields to include in the response.
If this parameter is specified, only these source fields are returned.
You can exclude fields from this subset using the `_source_excludes` query parameter.
If the `_source` parameter is `false`, this parameter is ignored.

search-seq_no_primary_term.name: seq_no_primary_term
search-seq_no_primary_term.description: If `true`, the request returns the sequence number and primary term of the last modification of each hit.

search-q.name: q
search-q.description:
A query in the Lucene query string syntax.
Query parameter searches do not support the full Elasticsearch Query DSL but are handy for testing.

IMPORTANT: This parameter overrides the query parameter in the request body.
If both parameters are specified, documents matching the query request body parameter are not returned.

search-size.name: size
search-size.description:
The number of hits to return.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

search-from.name: from
search-from.description:
The starting document offset, which must be non-negative.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

search_application.get_behavioral_analyt.name: name
search_application.get_behavioral_analyt.description: A list of analytics collections to limit the returned information

search_application.search-name.name: name
search_application.search-name.description: The name of the search application to be searched.

search_application.search-typed_keys.name: typed_keys
search_application.search-typed_keys.description: Determines whether aggregation names are prefixed by their respective types in the response.

search_mvt-index.name: index
search_mvt-index.description: Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, or aliases to search

search_mvt-field.name: field
search_mvt-field.description: Field containing geospatial data to return

search_mvt-zoom.name: zoom
search_mvt-zoom.description: Zoom level for the vector tile to search

search_mvt-x.name: x
search_mvt-x.description: X coordinate for the vector tile to search

search_mvt-y.name: y
search_mvt-y.description: Y coordinate for the vector tile to search

search_mvt-exact_bounds.name: exact_bounds
search_mvt-exact_bounds.description:
If `false`, the meta layer's feature is the bounding box of the tile.
If true, the meta layer's feature is a bounding box resulting from a
geo_bounds aggregation. The aggregation runs on <field> values that intersect
the <zoom>/<x>/<y> tile with wrap_longitude set to false. The resulting
bounding box may be larger than the vector tile.

search_mvt-extent.name: extent
search_mvt-extent.description: The size, in pixels, of a side of the tile. Vector tiles are square with equal sides.

search_mvt-grid_agg.name: grid_agg
search_mvt-grid_agg.description: Aggregation used to create a grid for `field`.

search_mvt-grid_precision.name: grid_precision
search_mvt-grid_precision.description:
Additional zoom levels available through the aggs layer. For example, if <zoom> is 7
and grid_precision is 8, you can zoom in up to level 15. Accepts 0-8. If 0, results
don't include the aggs layer.

search_mvt-grid_type.name: grid_type
search_mvt-grid_type.description:
Determines the geometry type for features in the aggs layer. In the aggs layer,
each feature represents a geotile_grid cell. If 'grid' each feature is a Polygon
of the cells bounding box. If 'point' each feature is a Point that is the centroid
of the cell.

search_mvt-size.name: size
search_mvt-size.description:
Maximum number of features to return in the hits layer. Accepts 0-10000.
If 0, results don't include the hits layer.

search_mvt-track_total_hits.name: track_total_hits
search_mvt-track_total_hits.description:
The number of hits matching the query to count accurately.
If `true`, the exact number of hits is returned at the cost of some performance.
If `false`, the response does not include the total number of hits matching the query.

search_mvt-with_labels.name: with_labels
search_mvt-with_labels.description:
If `true`, the hits and aggs layers will contain additional point features representing
suggested label positions for the original features.

* `Point` and `MultiPoint` features will have one of the points selected.
* `Polygon` and `MultiPolygon` features will have a single point generated, either the centroid, if it is within the polygon, or another point within the polygon selected from the sorted triangle-tree.
* `LineString` features will likewise provide a roughly central point selected from the triangle-tree.
* The aggregation results will provide one central point for each aggregation bucket.

All attributes from the original features will also be copied to the new label features.
In addition, the new features will be distinguishable using the tag `_mvt_label_position`.

search_template-index.name: index
search_template-index.description:
A comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
It supports wildcards (`*`).

search_template-allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
search_template-allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.
For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

search_template-ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
search_template-ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If `true`, network round-trips are minimized for cross-cluster search requests.

search_template-expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
search_template-expand_wildcards.description:
The type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.

search_template-explain.name: explain
search_template-explain.description: If `true`, the response includes additional details about score computation as part of a hit.

search_template-ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
search_template-ignore_throttled.description: If `true`, specified concrete, expanded, or aliased indices are not included in the response when throttled.

search_template-ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
search_template-ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

search_template-preference.name: preference
search_template-preference.description:
The node or shard the operation should be performed on.
It is random by default.

search_template-profile.name: profile
search_template-profile.description: If `true`, the query execution is profiled.

search_template-routing.name: routing
search_template-routing.description: A custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

search_template-scroll.name: scroll
search_template-scroll.description:
Specifies how long a consistent view of the index
should be maintained for scrolled search.

search_template-search_type.name: search_type
search_template-search_type.description: The type of the search operation.

search_template-rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
search_template-rest_total_hits_as_int.description:
If `true`, `hits.total` is rendered as an integer in the response.
If `false`, it is rendered as an object.

search_template-typed_keys.name: typed_keys
search_template-typed_keys.description: If `true`, the response prefixes aggregation and suggester names with their respective types.

security.create_api_key-refresh.name: refresh
security.create_api_key-refresh.description: If `true` (the default) then refresh the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` then do nothing with refreshes.

security.query_api_keys-with_limited_by.name: with_limited_by
security.query_api_keys-with_limited_by.description:
Return the snapshot of the owner user's role descriptors associated with the API key.
An API key's actual permission is the intersection of its assigned role descriptors and the owner user's role descriptors (effectively limited by it).
An API key cannot retrieve any API keys limited-by role descriptors (including itself) unless it has `manage_api_key` or higher privileges.

security.query_api_keys-with_profile_uid.name: with_profile_uid
security.query_api_keys-with_profile_uid.description:
Determines whether to also retrieve the profile UID for the API key owner principal.
If it exists, the profile UID is returned under the `profile_uid` response field for each API key.

security.query_api_keys-typed_keys.name: typed_keys
security.query_api_keys-typed_keys.description: Determines whether aggregation names are prefixed by their respective types in the response.

sql.query-format.name: format
sql.query-format.description:
The format for the response.
You can also specify a format using the `Accept` HTTP header.
If you specify both this parameter and the `Accept` HTTP header, this parameter takes precedence.

terms_enum-index.name: index
terms_enum-index.description:
A comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and index aliases to search.
Wildcard (`*`) expressions are supported.
To search all data streams or indices, omit this parameter or use `*`  or `_all`.

termvectors-index.name: index
termvectors-index.description: The name of the index that contains the document.

termvectors-id.name: id
termvectors-id.description: A unique identifier for the document.

termvectors-fields.name: fields
termvectors-fields.description:
A comma-separated list or wildcard expressions of fields to include in the statistics.
It is used as the default list unless a specific field list is provided in the `completion_fields` or `fielddata_fields` parameters.

termvectors-field_statistics.name: field_statistics
termvectors-field_statistics.description:
If `true`, the response includes:

* The document count (how many documents contain this field).
* The sum of document frequencies (the sum of document frequencies for all terms in this field).
* The sum of total term frequencies (the sum of total term frequencies of each term in this field).

termvectors-offsets.name: offsets
termvectors-offsets.description: If `true`, the response includes term offsets.

termvectors-payloads.name: payloads
termvectors-payloads.description: If `true`, the response includes term payloads.

termvectors-positions.name: positions
termvectors-positions.description: If `true`, the response includes term positions.

termvectors-preference.name: preference
termvectors-preference.description:
The node or shard the operation should be performed on.
It is random by default.

termvectors-realtime.name: realtime
termvectors-realtime.description: If true, the request is real-time as opposed to near-real-time.

termvectors-routing.name: routing
termvectors-routing.description: A custom value that is used to route operations to a specific shard.

termvectors-term_statistics.name: term_statistics
termvectors-term_statistics.description:
If `true`, the response includes:

* The total term frequency (how often a term occurs in all documents).
* The document frequency (the number of documents containing the current term).

By default these values are not returned since term statistics can have a serious performance impact.

termvectors-version.name: version
termvectors-version.description: If `true`, returns the document version as part of a hit.

transform.get_transform-transform_id.name: transform_id
transform.get_transform-transform_id.description:
Identifier for the transform. It can be a transform identifier or a
wildcard expression. You can get information for all transforms by using
`_all`, by specifying `*` as the `<transform_id>`, or by omitting the
`<transform_id>`.

transform.get_transform-allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
transform.get_transform-allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

1. Contains wildcard expressions and there are no transforms that match.
2. Contains the _all string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
3. Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

If this parameter is false, the request returns a 404 status code when
there are no matches or only partial matches.

transform.get_transform-from.name: from
transform.get_transform-from.description: Skips the specified number of transforms.

transform.get_transform-size.name: size
transform.get_transform-size.description: Specifies the maximum number of transforms to obtain.

transform.get_transform-exclude_generate.name: exclude_generated
transform.get_transform-exclude_generate.description:
Excludes fields that were automatically added when creating the
transform. This allows the configuration to be in an acceptable format to
be retrieved and then added to another cluster.

transform.preview_transform-transform_id.name: transform_id
transform.preview_transform-transform_id.description:
Identifier for the transform to preview. If you specify this path parameter, you cannot provide transform
configuration details in the request body.

transform.preview_transform-timeout.name: timeout
transform.preview_transform-timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response. If no response is received before the
timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

explain.description: If true, returns detailed information about score computation as part of a hit.

ext.description: Configuration of search extensions defined by Elasticsearch plugins.

from.description:
Starting document offset. By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000
hits using the from and size parameters. To page through more hits, use the
search_after parameter.

indices_boost.description: Boosts the _score of documents from specified indices.

docvalue_fields.description:
Array of wildcard (*) patterns. The request returns doc values for field
names matching these patterns in the hits.fields property of the response.

knn.description: Defines the approximate kNN search to run.

min_score.description:
Minimum _score for matching documents. Documents with a lower _score are
not included in search results and results collected by aggregations.

script_fields.description: Retrieve a script evaluation (based on different fields) for each hit.

size.description:
The number of hits to return. By default, you cannot page through more
than 10,000 hits using the from and size parameters. To page through more
hits, use the search_after parameter.

fields.description:
Array of wildcard (*) patterns. The request returns values for field names
matching these patterns in the hits.fields property of the response.

terminate_after.description:
Maximum number of documents to collect for each shard. If a query reaches this
limit, Elasticsearch terminates the query early. Elasticsearch collects documents
before sorting. Defaults to 0, which does not terminate query execution early.

timeout.description:
Specifies the period of time to wait for a response from each shard. If no response
is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
Defaults to no timeout.

track_scores.description: If true, calculate and return document scores, even if the scores are not used for sorting.

version.description: If true, returns document version as part of a hit.

seq_no_primary_term.description:
If true, returns sequence number and primary term of the last modification
of each hit. See Optimistic concurrency control.

stats.description:
Stats groups to associate with the search. Each group maintains a statistics
aggregation for its associated searches. You can retrieve these stats using
the indices stats API.

AsyncSearchSubmitRequestExample1.description: Perform a search request asynchronously with `POST /sales*/_async_search?size=0`. It accepts the same parameters and request body as the search API.

BulkRequestExample2.description: When you run `POST _bulk` and use the `update` action, you can use `retry_on_conflict` as a field in the action itself (not in the extra payload line) to specify how many times an update should be retried in the case of a version conflict.

BulkRequestExample3.description: To return only information about failed operations, run `POST /_bulk?filter_path=items.*.error`.

BulkRequestExample4.description: Run `POST /_bulk` to perform a bulk request that consists of index and create actions with the `dynamic_templates` parameter. The bulk request creates two new fields `work_location` and `home_location` with type `geo_point` according to the `dynamic_templates` parameter. However, the `raw_location` field is created using default dynamic mapping rules, as a text field in that case since it is supplied as a string in the JSON document.

that uses deprecated components, Elasticsearch will emit a deprecation warning.

ClusterPutComponentTemplateRequestExampl.description: You can include index aliases in a component template. During index creation, the `{index}` placeholder in the alias name will be replaced with the actual index name that the template gets applied to.

{

CountRequestExample1.description: Run `GET /my-index-000001/_count?q=user:kimchy`. Alternatively, run `GET /my-index-000001/_count` with the same query in the request body. Both requests count the number of documents in `my-index-000001` with a `user.id` of `kimchy`.

CreateRequestExample1.description: Run `PUT my-index-000001/_create/1` to index a document into the `my-index-000001` index if no document with that ID exists.

query.description: EQL query you wish to run.

filter.description: Query, written in Query DSL, used to filter the events on which the EQL query runs.

allow_partial_search_results.description:
Allow query execution also in case of shard failures.
If true, the query will keep running and will return results based on the available shards.
For sequences, the behavior can be further refined using allow_partial_sequence_results

allow_partial_sequence_results.description:
This flag applies only to sequences and has effect only if allow_partial_search_results=true.
If true, the sequence query will return results based on the available shards, ignoring the others.
If false, the sequence query will return successfully, but will always have empty results.

fields.description: Array of wildcard (*) patterns. The response returns values for field names matching these patterns in the fields property of each hit.

max_samples_per_key.description:
By default, the response of a sample query contains up to `10` samples, with one sample per unique set of join keys. Use the `size`
parameter to get a smaller or larger set of samples. To retrieve more than one sample per set of join keys, use the
`max_samples_per_key` parameter. Pipes are not supported for sample queries.

EqlSearchRequestExample1.description: Run `GET /my-data-stream/_eql/search` to search for events that have a `process.name` of `cmd.exe` and a  `process.pid` other than `2013`.

EqlSearchRequestExample2.description: Run `GET /my-data-stream/_eql/search` to search for a sequence of events. The sequence starts with an event with an `event.category` of `file`, a `file.name` of `cmd.exe`, and a `process.pid` other than `2013`. It is followed by an event with an `event.category` of `process` and a `process.executable` that contains the substring `regsvr32`. These events must also share the same `process.pid` value.
EqlSearchRequestExample2.value:
{
  "query": """
    sequence by process.pid
      [ file where file.name == "cmd.exe" and process.pid != 2013 ]
      [ process where stringContains(process.executable, "regsvr32") ]
  """
}

ExplainRequestExample1.description: Run `GET /my-index-000001/_explain/0` with the request body. Alternatively, run `GET /my-index-000001/_explain/0?q=message:elasticsearch`

FieldCapabilitiesRequestExample1.description: Run `POST my-index-*/_field_caps?fields=rating` to get field capabilities and filter indices with a query. Indices that rewrite the provided filter to `match_none` on every shard will be filtered from the response.

vertices.description: Specifies one or more fields that contain the terms you want to include in the graph as vertices.

GraphExploreRequestExample1.description: Run `POST clicklogs/_graph/explore` for a basic exploration An initial graph explore query typically begins with a query to identify strongly related terms. Seed the exploration with a query. This example is searching `clicklogs` for people who searched for the term `midi`.Identify the vertices to include in the graph. This example is looking for product codes that are significantly associated with searches for `midi`. Find the connections. This example is looking for other search terms that led people to click on the products that are associated with searches for `midi`.

IndexRequestExample1.description: Run `POST my-index-000001/_doc/` to index a document. When you use the `POST /<target>/_doc/` request format, the `op_type` is automatically set to `create` and the index operation generates a unique ID for the document.

IndexRequestExample2.description: Run `PUT my-index-000001/_doc/1` to insert a JSON document into the `my-index-000001` index with an `_id` of 1.

analyzer.description:
The name of the analyzer that should be applied to the provided `text`.
This could be a built-in analyzer, or an analyzer thats been configured in the index.

attributes.description: Array of token attributes used to filter the output of the `explain` parameter.

char_filter.description: Array of character filters used to preprocess characters before the tokenizer.

explain.description: If `true`, the response includes token attributes and additional details.

filter.description: Array of token filters used to apply after the tokenizer.

normalizer.description: Normalizer to use to convert text into a single token.

indicesAnalyzeRequestExample1.description: You can apply any of the built-in analyzers to the text string without specifying an index.

indicesAnalyzeRequestExample2.description: If the text parameter is provided as array of strings, it is analyzed as a multi-value field.

indicesAnalyzeRequestExample3.description: You can test a custom transient analyzer built from tokenizers, token filters, and char filters. Token filters use the filter parameter.

indicesAnalyzeRequestExample4.description: Custom tokenizers, token filters, and character filters can be specified in the request body.

indicesAnalyzeRequestExample5.description: Run `GET /analyze_sample/_analyze` to run an analysis on the text using the default index analyzer associated with the `analyze_sample` index. Alternatively, the analyzer can be derived based on a field mapping.

indicesAnalyzeRequestExample6.description: Run `GET /analyze_sample/_analyze` and supply a normalizer for a keyword field if there is a normalizer associated with the specified index.

indicesAnalyzeRequestExample7.description: If you want to get more advanced details, set `explain` to `true`. It will output all token attributes for each token. You can filter token attributes you want to output by setting the `attributes` option. NOTE: The format of the additional detail information is labelled as experimental in Lucene and it may change in the future.

is_write_index.description:
If `true`, sets the write index or data stream for the alias.
If an alias points to multiple indices or data streams and `is_write_index` isnt set, the alias rejects write requests.
If an index alias points to one index and `is_write_index` isnt set, the index automatically acts as the write index.
Data stream aliases dont automatically set a write data stream, even if the alias points to one data stream.

composed_of.description:
An ordered list of component template names.
Component templates are merged in the order specified, meaning that the last component template specified has the highest precedence.

priority.description:
Priority to determine index template precedence when a new data stream or index is created.
The index template with the highest priority is chosen.
If no priority is specified the template is treated as though it is of priority 0 (lowest priority).
This number is not automatically generated by Elasticsearch.

allow_auto_create.description:
This setting overrides the value of the `action.auto_create_index` cluster setting.
If set to `true` in a template, then indices can be automatically created using that template even if auto-creation of indices is disabled via `actions.auto_create_index`.
If set to `false`, then indices or data streams matching the template must always be explicitly created, and may never be automatically created.

ignore_missing_component_templates.description:
The configuration option ignore_missing_component_templates can be used when an index template
references a component template that might not exist

deprecated.description:
Marks this index template as deprecated. When creating or updating a non-deprecated index template
that uses deprecated components, Elasticsearch will emit a deprecation warning.

IndicesPutIndexTemplateRequestExample2.description:
You can include index aliases in an index template.
During index creation, the `{index}` placeholder in the alias name will be replaced with the actual index name that the template gets applied to.

date_detection.description: Controls whether dynamic date detection is enabled.

dynamic_date_formats.description:
If date detection is enabled then new string fields are checked
against 'dynamic_date_formats' and if the value matches then
a new date field is added instead of string.

dynamic_templates.description: Specify dynamic templates for the mapping.

numeric_detection.description: Automatically map strings into numeric data types for all fields.

properties.description:
Mapping for a field. For new fields, this mapping can include:

- Field name
- Field data type
- Mapping parameters

indicesPutMappingRequestExample1.description: The update mapping API can be applied to multiple data streams or indices with a single request. For example, run `PUT /my-index-000001,my-index-000002/_mapping` to update mappings for the `my-index-000001` and `my-index-000002` indices at the same time.

indicesPutSettingsRequestExample2.description: To revert a setting to the default value, use `null`.

indicesPutSettingsRequestExample3.description: To add an analyzer, you must close the index (`POST /my-index-000001/_close`), define the analyzer, then reopen the index (`POST /my-index-000001/_open`).

index_patterns.description:
Array of wildcard expressions used to match the names
of indices during creation.

order.description:
Order in which Elasticsearch applies this template if index
matches multiple templates.

Templates with lower 'order' values are merged first. Templates with higher
'order' values are merged later, overriding templates with lower values.

Aliases for the target index.
Data streams do not support this parameter.

settings.description:
Configuration options for the index.

This setting overrides the value of the `action.auto_create_index` cluster setting.
If set to `true` in a template, then indices can be automatically created using that template even if auto-creation of indices is disabled via `actions.auto_create_index`.
If set to `false`, then indices or data streams matching the template must always be explicitly created, and may never be automatically created.

composed_of.description:
An ordered list of component template names.
Component templates are merged in the order specified, meaning that the last component template specified has the highest precedence.

priority.description:
Priority to determine index template precedence when a new data stream or index is created.
The index template with the highest priority is chosen.
If no priority is specified the template is treated as though it is of priority 0 (lowest priority).

indicesSimulateTemplateRequestExample1.description: To see what settings will be applied by a template before you add it to the cluster, you can pass a template configuration in the request body. The specified template is used for the simulation if it has a higher priority than existing templates.

query.description:
The query input, which is required only for the `rerank` task.
It is not required for other tasks.

input.description:
The text on which you want to perform the inference task.
It can be a single string or an array.

> info
> Inference endpoints for the `completion` task type currently only support a single string as input.

input_type.description:
Specifies the input data type for the text embedding model. The `input_type` parameter only applies to Inference Endpoints with the `text_embedding` task type. Possible values include:
* `SEARCH`
* `INGEST`
* `CLASSIFICATION`
* `CLUSTERING`
Not all services support all values. Unsupported values will trigger a validation exception.
Accepted values depend on the configured inference service, refer to the relevant service-specific documentation for more info.

> info
> The `input_type` parameter specified on the root level of the request body will take precedence over the `input_type` parameter specified in `task_settings`.

MultiGetRequestExample2.description: Run `GET /_mget`. This request sets `_source` to `false` for document 1 to exclude the source entirely. It retrieves `field3` and `field4` from document 2. It retrieves the `user` field from document 3 but filters out the `user.location` field.

MultiGetRequestExample4.description: Run `GET /_mget?routing=key1`. If routing is used during indexing, you need to specify the routing value to retrieve documents. This request fetches `test/_doc/2` from the shard corresponding to routing key `key1`. It fetches `test/_doc/1` from the shard corresponding to routing key `key2`.
